text: Frederica Alexandrina Sagor Maas (; July 6, 1900 â€“ January 5, 2012) was an American playwright, screenwriter, essayist and author. She was the youngest daughter of Russian immigrants. She wrote for the film The Plastic Age, which helped with making Clara Bow well known. During the time of McCarthyism, Maas and her husband got into trouble because they read some works of Communism. She wrote an autobiography called The Shocking Miss Pilgrim: A Writer in Early Hollywood. == Other websites == * * Video of Frederica Sagor Maas at 100 from Reverie Productions * Interview with Frederica Sagor Maas at age 99 Category:1900 births Category:2012 deaths Category:American autobiographers Category:American supercentenarians Category:Screenwriters from New York City
title: Frederica Sagor Maas
